DOC.brief_summary: To compare Azithromycin plus Chloroquine versus Mefloquine to treat uncomplicated plasmodium falciparum malaria.
DOC.brief_title: Azithromycin Plus Chloroquine Versus Mefloquine In the Treatment of Uncomplicated P. Falciparum Malaria.
DOC.criteria: Females and males 18 years of age and older with uncomplicated, symptomatic malaria as as indicated by the presence of both of the following: Blood smears positive for Plasmodium falciparum asexual parasitemia between 1000 100,000 parasites Documented fever (38.5 C/101.3 F rectal or tympanic; 37.5 C/99.5 F axillary or 38 C/100.4 F oral) or history of fever (as reported by subject) within the prior 24 hours. Severe or complicated malaria. Pregnant or breastfeeding women.
